TEXT: CARDINAL . Mr Oberschlick , a journalist living in GPE , was at the material time editor of the periodical Forum .

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE on the occasion of a " peace celebration " ( ORG ) at the foot of the PERSON , PERSON , leader of ORG ( ORG ) and Governor ( PERSON ) of the Land of Carinthia , gave a speech glorifying the role of the " generation of soldiers " who had taken part in the Second World War . In it he said that all soldiers , including those in the NORP army , had fought for peace and freedom and that people should therefore not differentiate between " good " and " bad " soldiers of that generation but should rather be grateful to all of them for having founded and built DATE ’s affluent , democratic society . Mr PERSON then criticised an NORP writer who had , in his view , disparaged all those killed in the Second World War , and continued as follows :

" Ladies and gentlemen , freedom of opinion is taken for granted in a democracy , but it reaches its limits where people lay claim to that spiritual freedom they would never have got if others had not risked their lives for them so that they may now live in democracy and freedom . "

CARDINAL . ORG This speech was reproduced in full in Forum and commented on by the applicant and the aforementioned NORP writer . Mr PERSON ’s passage , entitled " P.S. : ‘ GPE statt ‘ Nazi’ " ( " P.S. : ` Idiot’ instead of ` Nazi’ " ) , read as follows :

" I will say of PERSON , firstly , that he is not a NORP and , secondly , that he is , however , an idiot . That I justify as follows : [ L. ] [ ... ] wholly convinced me that being called a NORP is an advantage to PERSON . That is why I ask my friends to forgive my abstaining from using that description for that very good reason .

As [ PERSON ] denies those of us who in his eyes did not have the legitimising good fortune [ legitimierende GPE ] to have risked our lives in the uniform of honour [ Ehrenkleid ] of ORG for the NORP freedom to wage wars of conquest [ ORG ] and impose the final solution , [ and as he denies us ] the right ‘ to lay claim to a purely " spiritual " freedom of GPE , let alone a " political freedom " , and he himself has never had the good fortune to serve in the uniform of honour of the ORG or the NORP army [ Wehrmacht ] , thus excluding himself along with the vast majority of NORP from any exercise of freedom , he is , in my eyes , an idiot . "

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE Mr PERSON brought an action for defamation ( üble GPE ) and insult ( PERSON ) against the applicant in ORG ( PERSON für PERSON - " the Regional Court " ) . He also applied for an order for the immediate seizure of the relevant issue of the periodical and for an announcement of the institution of proceedings to be published in Forum .
CARDINAL . ORG On DATE the court allowed the application for an announcement to be published , but on CARDINAL DATE Mr PERSON appealed against that decision .

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE the court found the applicant guilty under LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) of having insulted Mr PERSON and sentenced him to pay DATE - fines of CARDINAL NORP schillings ( ORG ) , with CARDINAL days’ imprisonment in default . In the court ’s view , the word GPE was an insult ( PERSON ) and could only ever be used as a disparagement ( GPE ) ; it therefore could never be used for any objective criticism ( sachliche ORG ) . In the written version of the judgment the court ordered the seizure of the relevant issue of Forum .

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal ( GPE ) against that judgment . In his submission , the court had held that the expression in question constituted an insult to Mr PERSON because it had disregarded the context in which it had been used . If the court had taken into account the whole of the article and its line of argument , it would have realised that the term complained of was justified since it served as a conclusion to the finding that Mr PERSON had in his speech excluded himself from the enjoyment of freedom of opinion .
Mr PERSON also complained that the seizure of the relevant issue of Forum had not been ordered when judgment was given .
CARDINAL . ORG On DATE the applicant asked for the record of the hearing to be rectified and supplemented .
CARDINAL . ORG On DATE ORG rectified part of the record and refused the further amendments sought by the applicant as irrelevant . On DATE he lodged an appeal ( Beschwerde ) against that decision .
CARDINAL . ORG In the meantime , on DATE , ORG had rectified its judgment and removed from it the order for the seizure of Forum .

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE ORG ( Oberlandesgericht ) dismissed the applicant ’s appeal against the order to publish an announcement about the proceedings instituted by PERSON ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) . On DATE ORG declared inadmissible the appeal against the decision to rectify the record of the hearing ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) .
CARDINAL . ORG On DATE ORG upheld ORG judgment but reduced the rate of the day - fine to ORG CARDINAL ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) .

It noted that the word in issue appeared in the title of the article . Only those who had read not just the lines written by the applicant but also PERSON PERSON ’s speech and the comments accompanying it in Forum would understand that Mr PERSON had called the speaker an " idiot " as , in his view , he had in his speech excluded himself and the vast majority of NORP from the enjoyment of freedom of opinion . Those who had not would link the term GPE not with the conclusion that could be drawn from Mr PERSON ’s words but with his own person . It thus amounted to an insult that overstepped the limits of acceptable objective criticism ( die PERSON sachlich zulässiger ORG ) and PERSON must have been aware of that . At the most , he could have described the consequences of PERSON PERSON ’s remarks as stupid ( vertrottelt ) .

Admittedly , politicians who supported opinions that were open to criticism had to accept that they would be subject to especially hard - hitting attacks , even personal ones . The right to freedom of opinion must not , however , lead to insults replacing arguments of substance in political debate . The fact that a politician resorted to insults did not justify his detractors doing the same , unless personally provoked . Taking LAW ( article CARDINAL ) as the basis for a right to insult someone would bring about a general debasement ( generelle ORG ) of political debate .
CARDINAL . ORG The relevant provisions of LAW read as follows :

" CARDINAL . Anyone who , in such a way that it may be noticed by a third person , attributes to another a contemptible characteristic or sentiment or accuses him of behaviour contrary to honour or morality and such as to make him contemptible or otherwise lower him in public esteem shall be liable to imprisonment not exceeding DATE or a fine ...

CARDINAL . Anyone who commits this offence in a printed document , by broadcasting or otherwise in such a way as to make the defamation accessible to a broad section of the public shall be liable to imprisonment not exceeding one year or a fine ...

CARDINAL . The person making the statement shall not be punished if it is proved to be true . In the case of the offence defined in paragraph CARDINAL he shall also not be liable if circumstances are established which gave him sufficient reason to believe that the statement was true . "

" CARDINAL . Anyone who , in public or in the presence of several others , insults , mocks , mistreats or threatens to mistreat a third person , shall be liable to imprisonment not exceeding DATE or a fine ... unless he is liable to a more severe penalty under another provision .

CARDINAL . Anyone who , solely from indignation at the behaviour of another person , allows himself to be provoked into insulting , mistreating or threatening to mistreat that person in a way that is excusable in the circumstances , shall have a defence if his indignation is understandable to the average person , regard being had in particular to the time that has elapsed since the event that provoked it . "
